Articles.Content:
I thin KSP2 would benefit tremendously from adding an ultra low graphics setting focused purely on performance, this would open up the huge market of budget pcs allowing playing it on old hardware at reasonable fps. I care about graphics but id rather have playable fps with n64 graphics than unplayable fps with aaa graphics.

 

essentially a ksp 1 graphics setting.

Edited March 3 by Ryaja

Sure, I totally agree with that, but I don't think it's as simple as said. Like many people on other communities stating they want a game to just use up more cores for better performance don't seem to understand that you can't simply distribute every calculation on all the cores to get more FPS. A graphics card sure is similar on that argumentation and sometimes the graphics alone isn't even the root problem. Because a code piece by itself can be a limitation too. Bet there is already lots of work on their list for graphics. I mean, they care about old and different systems and colonies needs the optimization after all.

So, what do you think how much work would be needed for implementing low poly models? I get what you mean, but I think that it does more harm than good and doesn't even meet the expectations. Looking at the performance jumps from patch to patch, that's at least equal from what I would expect from you approach right now.
